issues.description: In the template repository Stock.getStockIngredients() returns a List<StockIngredient> (converting the internal array to a List), while the solution repository's Stock.getStockIngredients() returns a StockIngredient[] (the raw backing field). The problem statement asks students to "add getters for all the private fields" but does not specify the return type for the stockIngredients getter. This creates a structural inconsistency across artifacts (template vs. solution) and a minor inner-template mismatch because the template's setter uses StockIngredient[] while its getter returns List<StockIngredient>. Students comparing template and solution (or following the instruction to create getters for private fields) may be confused about the intended getter type for stockIngredients and which type to use in their SealSaloon implementation.
issues.suggested_fix: Unify the getter return type for stockIngredients across template and solution. Prefer returning StockIngredient[] (to match the private field and the setter) or explicitly document in the problem statement that the getter should return List<StockIngredient>. Update the template's getStockIngredients() to return StockIngredient[] (or update the solution to return List<StockIngredient>) and ensure the problem text specifies the expected getter signature so students are not uncertain.
